unnormalised: ## Finding My Shanti: A Journey Through Yoga Practices
normalised: ## Finding My Shanti: A Journey Through Yoga Practices

unnormalised: Ever since Dr. Sharma recommended yoga for my stress levels, I've been diving headfirst into the world of asanas and pranayama. It started, as most things do, with a Google search and a slightly wobbly attempt at Trikonasana in my 600 sq ft apartment. My first real experience, however, was a trial class at the Isha Yoga Center in Coimbatore. The sheer serenity of the place, the chanting…it was a world away from the chaotic streets of Mumbai.

My first real experience, however, was a trial class at the Isha Yoga Center in Coimbatore. The sheer serenity of the place, the chanting…it was a world away from the chaotic streets of Mumbai.

unnormalised: Initially, I struggled. My hamstrings screamed bloody murder during Paschimottanasana, and I could barely hold a plank for 30 seconds. I felt completely inadequate compared to the lithe women effortlessly flowing through Surya Namaskar. But I persevered, remembering my grandmother's advice: "Little drops of water make a mighty ocean."

unnormalised: Slowly but surely, I started noticing changes. My back pain, a constant companion after years of hunching over a computer, began to ease. I felt calmer, more grounded. The daily commute, usually a source of intense frustration, became a little less stressful. I even managed to hold Sirsasana (headstand) for a whole 10 seconds – a personal victory!

unnormalised: Now, my yoga mat is my sanctuary. Whether it’s a quick 15-minute session of gentle stretches before work or a longer, more focused practice on the weekends, it's my time to connect with my body and my breath. I've even incorporated some Ayurvedic principles into my routine, adjusting my practice based on the seasons. For example, during the hot summer months, I focus on cooling pranayamas like Sitali.

unnormalised: I still have a long way to go. I dream of one day effortlessly performing advanced poses like Natarajasana. But for now, I'm content with the small victories and the growing sense of peace that yoga brings to my life. And perhaps, invest in a better yoga mat, as this one cost me only Rs. 500 and is starting to fray! My next goal is to run 5 km without stopping, and I'm hoping yoga will help me get there. Shanti, shanti, shanti.
